content: App has always worked well but I wish that you could set up actions automatically e.g. enter good night mode at 8pm

Limited feature, work as another remote control. I want to automatively open and close my blinds at fixed schedule time, which is still not suppoeted yet. And no way to integrate with Alexa or Smartthings yet.
I am totally confused. What a useless company Velux is

Heel erg gelimiteerde app. - Waarom niet de mogelijkheid om bij regenval te zeggen minimaal 10% open blijven zodat het wel goed blijft luchten - waarom een pincode invoeren bij het openen van de ramen als je Google Assistent niet gebruikt - Geen support voor IFTTT - eigen schema's instellen zou ook handig zijn Daarnaast is de Android app ook altijd de connectie kwijt met de ramen en de rolluiken. Elk raam en Luik apart moeten refreshen om weer toegang te krijgen.

Not for slow internet connections. Knocked out the internet every time I use it on my smart phone. Wall mount works OK. Setup on phone took 4 hours and a visit from the installer to hook it up,then when I went to use it it knocked out the internet each time I tried to use it. Guess I won't be using the remote on my phone.
not working at all,the app is not matched products.
Why must I setup a PIN and then enter it every time I want to use my skylights? Ugh.
Does not work with 5ghz wifi so is completely useless with modern routers, can't keep switching just for this 1 app. Velux active needs upgrading to 5ghz until then I can't use it.

Why so restrictive? You can't set any schedule, you can't make any changes like shutting the blinds all the way (rather than 80% shut so there's still sun damage to your floors and furniture) without pausing Active Control. Why not have the ability to change where it gets its weather forecast (like a Smartthings or IFTTT enabled home weather station)? We live too far (as do most people) from where it receives weather forecasts to be accurate. There's been no new innovation...the app is dead.

Clunky and buggy to get working, but then it gives you really useful capability. It's incredibly circuitous to register your new skylights without the tablet remote, took a call to customer service. The app kicks you out to the starting screen whenever you edit a setting. It's painful to do simple things like schedule the blinds going up. That said, once you fight your way through, it works.
Awful, so far
Works better than the included remotes.
This app sucks. I logged in and it gives me a blank screen.
No option to set a timer/program which means app and active can't replace KLR 200... need 2 controllers! Should be easy function to add so no idea why not included. Please, please add.
Keep getting errors that windows and blinds are "unreachable" and it's unclear how to fix it
Good for a week... now keep getting errors and have to refresh each window as they are "unreachable"

Useless. We got new skylights with blinds and I have tried all weekend to get this app to work. When I try to connect my phone, all I get is an "oops - something happened - try again" message". Now it says that the internet isn't available (which is totally wrong). And the "help" FAQs require you to be an IT person and fool around with your router settings (which I have no idea how to do and no inclination to learn). This shouldn't be that difficult!.

Does not work without Google Services (cannot connect to the Server due to bad network connection). It would have potential, but it is not really developed any further. Not an added value against the old fashioned control panels.
So far so good. Solar power blinds... 3 months in.

The App works like intended but there is no option to directly control the windows and shutters within the Google Home App. The only option to control them is via a voice command through the Google Assistant. Dear Velux Developer Team, Please add the functionality to directly control devices within the Google Home App.

Excellent system. Just wish you could use your voice with Google to open the velux without the pin request. Also it needs better options within Google home but I am sure you will keep developing the integration.
Fantastic when it works, and a great idea, but zero technical support when it doesn't, and very cheap equipment to go along with it.

Contractors installed my 3 Velux Skylights yesterday with solar shades. Downloaded and installed the Velux Active Android app and went to sign on but no luck. Scott from Velux support called and had me switch to another email address and that worked.
Pretty neat to watch it open and close on its own!

Sort of works, but I do operate it manually via the app and open my manual windows. It says it's too hot to air the room (even though it's cooling down outside in the evening and boiling inside). Allow windows to stay open on hot nights doesn't seem to work as it shuts them anyway after the automatic period. If they just allowed you to set a minimum opening as well as a maximum then I could stop it closing the ventilation flap that is noisy enough to wake you up. They should do user testing.
Keeps asking to authenticate but authentication never works. Lost all control over windows and there aren't even any troubleshooting steps.

Add a "refresh all" button. The app is ok but every time I open it there is no connection to the windows. Hitting the refresh button for each window corrects this but it's tedious when you have 7 windows, each with blinds. Another frustration with the app is when it's telling me I can't open the windows because it's raining when it's not. Please add a "it's not raining" override button as well. So close to being a great app.
Superb feature of Velux

I think this system has a potential but lacking a few things: better cooperation with philips hue so you can put a rule in IFTTT in combination with goodnight. Also a schedule for weekdays and weekends to close and open automatically. Nevertheless i would avsolutely advice even if it s neratmo and all my heating is tado. Excellent windows with a little spark of smart, what do you need more?
Can't program opening or closing times. What's the point of the app, it just makes my phone another switch.

It's pretty good. Not fitted blinds yet but the windows work well. You can group them into rooms for single button press which is great. Two things I feel are missing. Alexa is a must for me. I thought I could get round that with IFTT but you have to have Apple Home Hub to use that. Please add Alexa support. Also it could really do with a schedule option. Not just a timer. I'd like a permenant 11pm close schedule for when I forget.

Per il controllo clima in casa è fantastica. La Configurazione è lentssima, una guida con un po di più di istruzioni sarebbe utile ad esempio come resettare il gateway senza ricorrere al sito internet. Ho fatto un logout per errore e devo ripetere tutta la procedura di autenticazione. Per fortuna sono a casa e posso procedere ma se mi trovo fuori?

Don't understand how someone can design this app and not include the most basic functionality - to open the blinds when the sun comes up and close them when it goes down. Isn't that how most people use their blinds? Completely baffling. Apart from that, it's good. At least it can open the windows when it gets too hot. And it DOES work with Google Home, or at least mine does! "Hey Google - open the blinds" is great especially given what I said above!

this is the worst app ever. even though it was promised two years ago, there is still no support for google home. also, the authentication process drives me crazy. it simply does not work if you have more than 1 device.

All very easy to set up but the windows lose connectivity constantly, every 30 minutes or so. Refreshing fixes but it's an irritation. Also the automated feature doesn't work how I would expect. If you have an upper and lower temp set surely the window should just stay open until you're at the lower temp. Instead it just seems to open for 10-15 minutes and then closes again. Then has to open again shortly after as it's still too hot! Not quite as clever as I'd like!
I can not get it activate! I have Samsung phone and the app worked ONCE with my phone and then it deactivated. I now only receive errors messages and the tech from Velux has been of no use.
I cant not link the Velux Active with NETATMO with the Google home and the Google home app. I'm very angry becasue I've waste a lot of time trying to link it.
Exceptional addition to Velux set up.

First, I have a Pixel 3 with Android 10 and I could not get the gateway to connect to the WiFi network. Switched to my wife's iPhone and it worked perfect. I wish devices like this would also include a wired ethernet port. Once I got it setup on the iPhone, I was able to log in on my Pixel and everything works fine. That said, the UI is a little confusing. For example, to open the blind you move the slider to the left, but to open the skylight you move the slider to the right. It's fine, but not great. I simply bought Active system so I could open and close from my phone because the physical remotes are big and ugly; I just didn't want them on display in my house. It accomplishes this, so I'm happy, but the Android app really needs work.
Very convenient app to pilot your windows! Google assistant integration is a good thing!
I love my new solar skylights and the easy of controlling them with my phone app. I highly recommend this product and the app.
Having to buy a $300 bridge just for 1 blind to integrate with google home is pointless. Unlock the product....

Does the job but lacks true smarts like being able to manually close the blinds without pausing the rest of the active feature. Closing blinds at sunset would be a nice idea. Would love IFTT and Alexa support too. It's just bit dumb compared to other smart home stuff.

Customisation of options is limited otherwise so far so good. Would be good to be able to group blinds and windows for manual operation. Would be better if there was more control of room airing so you could specify the maximum length and minimum outside temperature. Gateway would not use dual band Access Point from list of WiFi where the SSID is the same on both bands but worked when I put the SSID name in. Gateway dropped once because power lead does not fit securely.
opens and closes windows and shutters but could do more. for example allow to schedule openings and closings. and needs definitely Google home, Alexa and IFTT compatibility
Hard to program and after update won't connect to network and there is no option to change settings
Very difficult to set up. Not very user friendly.
App is good and always getting better. Love the active control features. App takes care of controlling the opening, closing, and shading of our Velux solar powered skylights
There is no reason to need my location. Uninstalled before I even got to try.
Does what is says in the tin. I have my skylight open alot more nowadays now I know it will shut if it rains and can shut it from anywhere in the world. Great idea works perfectly

The app works with my shades. BUT the UX is very confusing. Took me a while to discover I can set a schedule in the ACTIVE Control menu item in the shade item. Why can't I set Scenarios? Why can't I configure the shades to open and close at dawn?   What does the 'with NETAMO' mean? I have NETAMO already in my house but could not find anyway to link both? Could I connect the shades to the wind/rain sensor to close the shades depending on these?  For this price I do not see a lot of added value and would expect a lot of more features to be really called 'smart' which I expect to be there from Day 1 on.

can not set winter and summer blind schedules. only one daily time schedule option. switching back to my old remote control so I can set schedules for Skylight and blinds. how about Google home integration Android is more popular than iPhone.
expensive piece of kit that will not install. Help is poor. Waste of time and money.

This app and the whole concept seems slick, but the gateway hardware is a hot mess. Took over a dozen full reset / try again loops to recognize the sensors and skylights. Once set up, loses contact with the skylight after 30min and must powercycle the gateway to bring it back. Repeat every 30min. Filled out the contact form on their support site nearly a week ago but have yet to hear anything. Serious disappointment for $300.
allows me to control my skylight when i am not home. Exactly what i was looking for

Missing integration with Google Assistant ? In August 2018, you said it would be soon available.. We're 9 months later.. Sorry, removing 2 stars for a setup that cost more than 1500euros for 2 windows.
easy to use. faultless performance. If only every home automation app was this good.

App works perfectly for me. However, the slider bars to open/close the blinds and skylights work in opposite directions. It's COUNTERINTUITIVE and confusing. It should be that when you swipe RIGHT, it should OPEN the blind or skylight. Swipe Left should CLOSE the blind or skylight.
Nice app but lacking Google Assist integration

Please sort out this app! It started off quite promising and has gone downhill from there. Other than costing a lot of money, this opens my roof windows outside of the times and temperature that I set in parameters, as if it just overides the settings and now opens the windows in the middle of the bloody night. This is costing me more money in wasted heating. THIS IS APPALLING! SOMEBODY SORT THIS OUT.
Installed it, had to agree to allowing pretty much all and sundry to contact me via email/phone about pretty much anything on the planet before it would continue. Promptly uninstalled.
it doesn't offer any prompt for the 300 series product that I have.

So far not so good.. setup was easy. everything works when I am local and on wifi. I can not monitor my house while away? full 4g LTE, and I am told it has a bad internet connection and cannot connect to the server. so far this is not really different from the manual remotes that came with the skylights.

Promising idea but surprisingly it doesn't work for me.   If a room is too warm I expected the thermostat to trigger and open the Velux automatically but the Active system doesn't allow this if the outside temperature is low. I don't care how cold it is outside, I want to vent heat from the house and this system isn't clever enough to automatically do that. It will partially open and then close itself after 15 minutes even if the inside temperature is still too hot.  As I said, a promising idea but the basic functionality of keeping a room cool should be built into it. I'm awaiting information from Velux and Netatmo about possible updates to the functionality of the system/app before I return the product.

It took at lot of tries to get the gateway connected in the first place, but eventually got there. Using the app frequently tells me the system cannot connect to the network. However, when it works it does control my windows and blinds!
Needs Google Home and/or Smartthings integration. Can you give an ETA to integration??
Missing integrations is the major drawback

I have three windows and blinds in the same room. Why is there no option to group these so I can simply open all three windows together. I have to select and open each in turn. Even the normal remote can do this. Also please add Google assistant functionality
Does the Netamo support Google Home yet? I want to buy the system but only if it can be incorporated with Google Home and IFTTT.

I am using this on Android and it works great. However voice interaction is 
only available via iOS app. This is a big disappointment. Please get voice 
interaction working android via Alexa, Google assistant or Samsung 
Smartthings to make this product 5 star

Nonstarter: the app will not connect to the gateway. Tried the iOS version 
of the app and it works fine.
